summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Ghislaine Maxwell, informing her of the password for a disc containing discovery materials related to her criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The recipient of the letter, who is incarcerated at MDC Brooklyn and is the defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter.

connections.description: Williams, as the U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority corresponding with the defendant, Maxwell, regarding discovery in her criminal case.

events.title: Discovery Password Notification
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends a letter to Ghislaine Maxwell providing the password for a disc containing discovery materials pertinent to her criminal case.

locations: U.S. Department of Justice, Southern District of New York, The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
MDC Brooklyn Metropolitan Detention Center, P.O. Box 329002, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is official correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Ghislaine Maxwell regarding her criminal case (20 Cr. 330).
It confirms that discovery materials were provided to Maxwell on a password-protected disc as of October 2021.
Ghislaine Maxwell was incarcerated at the MDC Brooklyn Metropolitan Detention Center at the time.
Damian Williams was the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York overseeing the case.
